title: General Training Set 21 — Language Club & Public Transport
description: Formal letter about launching a workplace language club and an essay on subsidised public transport.

task1.title: Letter to a human resources manager
task1.prompt: Your company has recently hired many international employees who would like to improve their language skills. Write a letter to the human resources manager proposing a lunchtime language club. In your letter: explain why employees are interested in the club, describe the format and resources you would need, and request support to promote the initiative.
hints: Adopt a professional and respectful tone appropriate for a manager.
Provide clear details about scheduling and participation.
Suggest benefits for the company such as inclusion or teamwork.

task2.title: Opinion essay — Subsidised public transport
task2.prompt: Some people think local governments should offer free or heavily discounted public transport to reduce congestion and pollution. Do you agree or disagree?
outline: Introduction: paraphrase the statement and give your overall opinion.
Body paragraph 1: present arguments supporting subsidies, with examples.
Body paragraph 2: acknowledge limitations or alternative solutions if relevant.
Conclusion: restate your stance and recommend how authorities should proceed.
